content: a crafters are gonna have some more Halloween fun today as we build an
entire haunted location so that's gonna be pretty cool this is this video series
gonna be multiple videos but we're going to build on each craft and make an

font that this haunted power comes out of I guess so
today we'll work on that and then we'll continue down the line and make all the
stuff for this haunted location so let's go to the table and show you how I
started that here's my haunted location and I spooky
it up with a black light and some low lighting also you can see the ghost well
in the center is lit up with the effect coming out of it really neat so we're
gonna build all these pieces to make this lurching trees the ghost well and
the ground detail so we'll start the ghost well now so here's my material
it's a dollar store foam core and I peeled the paper off one side and I've
marked it in half inch marks because I'm going to cut this so I I want it to be
round I want to be like a well so I've also marked a Nathan of an inch mark
next to each half inch mark I'm gonna pull those up and make kind of a curve
decoration on the well so I'll just pull the decoration up I'm not worried about
too much it's gonna be a ruin it doesn't have to be totally perfect I just want
to get the general gist of it and there we go I've got it all marked
up now a quick way to kind of stress this up is just use a plastic fork or a
fork and you get some nice detail into that foam core now I'll just cut the
marks and cut it straight down to the paper I don't want to cut through the
paper this is just a carving tool that I have you can use about anything and just
go along all the marks that I've drawn on the the foam core and that'll dig
into it and give it the texture that you want so now I've cut the straight pieces
you can see it's kind of curved a bit and now I just need to curve a little
more kind of break those connections and then glue the end and then I can get the
the circular piece that I need for the well okay I'll let that hot glue set for
a second and it'll be good to go really like that detail on there that's a great
way to work a circular object okay now I'm going to use my carving tool and
just jab into the foam core a little bit so it will have some more distressing
and this is a ruin so I want to add some more detail to it so there we go nice
alright so now I got a square base is two and a half inches wide and I've
marked in the well so I can get the center and I've just Criss crossed each
corner and of the piece and then I did a quarter of
an inch along the edge and this is just I have the paper on the bottom but I've
pulled the paper off the top of this I'm just gonna follow the lines of the foam
core and same type of thing just to stress it with the fork same detail and
then I'll just punch those corners and pull out some foam core just to make it
look distressed just ripping some right out the lines and there we go we got a
nice base for that the ghost well now I've cut them I've cut the circle out so
that it goes through the bottom of the piece and now I'm going to strengthen
this up a bit I'm gonna use just white glue and use some water and wet it down
a bit just so it flows easily over the piece and then just cover the entire
piece with the white glue that'll add some strength as well as make it
impervious to most of the spray painting that you want to do you could actually
paint it by hand but I like to spray paint so just make sure that's all
covered and I can actually glue that on the base with some glue around the
bottom and we'll let it dry up sit up there and and dry up ready for the next
step okay here we go it's already and it's hardened up a bit so now I've got
some really thin cardboard I don't use this for the base just to give a little
more strength on the bottom okay so I'm just gonna measure it around the piece
itself and I'll measure the center so I know where the hole is because I
actually want to put something I want to put a light in the hole line to know
where that is so now I'll cut that out pre cut that
out and there's the light I'm going to use it's just like a little wedding
floaty light you can use a tea light also and I like the floaty light because
it's brighter than a tea light so I was that to the base and I've cut a little
piece quarter-inch of the foam core and I'm gonna use this to hold up the
swirling miasma that's gonna be in the well itself and so I'm just gonna glue
those just under the surface of the lip of the well so that will they'll be
holders to hold up the piece it'll be sitting on there and
you'll see that when I get to it so now I'll actually glue that bottom to the
piece and I'll give a nice strength to it now this is a ruin so I want to add
some rubble of course so I'm gonna use my white glue and just pick out some
areas you don't want to put too much on that you don't go too crazy with it and
then I'll just pour on my construction stands standard sand with a different
sized aggregate and let it dry up so now it's dried up I want to add a little
another another feature to it and a little detail some dead plants that are
maybe growing out for the cracks so I'll cut a couple pieces off this plastic
plant that I've got and use those time to seize a toothpick and poke in to the
foam core and just glue it right in with the white glue and I got a little really
little one there I'll put the bigger ones up against the well so they can
have something to lean against and have I'll be able to glue them to the well so
though they'll stay in place okay see I'll just glue the the tip and then lean
against the well and glue it and I'm using white glue hot glue would be
pretty messy doing this get all over the place
so white glue almost goes away when it dry so I like that effect there we go
some nice weeds there now I'm going to add more sand to the base of the weeds
that will kind of hide the fact where the weed goes into the foam core itself
I'm not getting up on the weed I'm just the very base of the weed or the dead
